info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 8:26PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Catawba and west central Iredell Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 826 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northeast of Newton, or near Claremont, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Statesville, Conover, Claremont, Catawba, Lookout Shoals Lake, Lake Norman State Park, St. Stephens, Lake Norman and Sherrills Ford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
